block.p: Susannah Courtney Friedman, the daughter of Margaret and Robert S. Friedman of Manhattan, was married yesterday to Harry Edward Stallman Vickers, the son of Georgia S. Vickers of Rye, N.Y., and Leonard Vickers of South Norwalk, Conn. Justice Eileen Bransten of State Supreme Court in Manhattan officiated at the Friends Meeting House in Manhattan.

Mrs. Vickers, 30, is the director of district operations for State Assemblyman Scott M. Stringer, a Democrat who represents the Upper West Side of Manhattan. She graduated from Pitzer College in Claremont, Calif., and received a master's degree in public administration from New York University. Her father, a sculptor and printmaker, is an adjunct professor of art history at both New York University and the Borough of Manhattan Community College. Her mother is a publicist for classical music organizations and the executive director of the Washington Square Music Festival.

Susannah Courtney Friedman, the daughter of Margaret and Robert S. Friedman of Manhattan, was married yesterday to Harry Edward Stallman Vickers, the son of Georgia S. Vickers of Rye, N.Y., and Leonard Vickers of South Norwalk, Conn. Justice Eileen Bransten of State Supreme Court in Manhattan officiated at the Friends Meeting House in Manhattan.

Mrs. Vickers, 30, is the director of district operations for State Assemblyman Scott M. Stringer, a Democrat who represents the Upper West Side of Manhattan. She graduated from Pitzer College in Claremont, Calif., and received a master's degree in public administration from New York University. Her father, a sculptor and printmaker, is an adjunct professor of art history at both New York University and the Borough of Manhattan Community College. Her mother is a publicist for classical music organizations and the executive director of the Washington Square Music Festival.

Mr. Vickers, who is 32 and is known as Ned, is a sports and event marketing consultant in Manhattan. He is also developing an Internet business called NEDexpress.com, which plans to deliver groceries and other items in Lower Manhattan. He graduated from Whittier College and received a certificate in sports entertainment and events marketing from N.Y.U. His mother is a residential sales associate in the Rye office of Houlihan Lawrence, a real estate agency. His father, who retired as a senior vice president for marketing in the Stamford, Conn., office of the Xerox Corporation, is a marketing consultant in Manhattan. The bridegroom is the stepson of Gunilla F. Vickers.
